Jorgen Bjerkness is a necrophiliac because he has sex with dead people all the time. His motto is "the older the better" when he is digging people up from their grave.
 
'''Necrophilia''', also called '''thanatophilia''', and '''necrolagnia''', is the [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to [[Cadaver|corpses]]. It is classified as a [[paraphilia]] by the [[Diagnostic and Statistical Manual]] of the [[American Psychiatric Association]]. The word is artificially derived from the ancient Greek words: ''[[wikt:Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ|Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ]]'' (''nekros''; "dead") and ''[[wikt:ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î±|ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î±]]'' (''philia''; "love"). The term appears to have originated from [[Richard Freiherr von Krafft-Ebing|Krafft-Ebing]]'s 1886 work ''[[Psychopathia Sexualis (book)|Psychopathia Sexualis]]''.<ref>Krafft-Ebing, Richard von (1886). ''Psychopathia Sexualis''. English translation: ISBN 1-55970-425-X.</ref>
'''Necrophilia''', also called '''thanatophilia''', and '''necrolagnia''', is the [[human sexuality|sexual]] attraction to [[Cadaver|corpses]]. It is classified as a [[paraphilia]] by the [[Diagnostic and Statistical Manual]] of the [[American Psychiatric Association]]. The word is artificially derived from the ancient Greek words: ''[[wikt:Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ|Î½ÎµÎºÏÏÏ]]'' (''nekros''; "dead") and ''[[wikt:ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î±|ÏÎ¹Î»Î¯Î±]]'' (''philia''; "love"). The term appears to have originated from [[Richard Freiherr von Krafft-Ebing|Krafft-Ebing]]'s 1886 work ''[[Psychopathia Sexualis (book)|Psychopathia Sexualis]]''.<ref>Krafft-Ebing, Richard von (1886).
